body: This shit has been happening for over a month now, I've followed all of RIOT's help-fix solutions for this and also checked around the community for a solution to this problem. NO FIX. I've been getting this error multiple times a day when going from champion select to loading screen and I submitted a ticket with no response. I have already lost tons of LP because of this, not to mention I've been leave-bustered multiple times and added to the low-priority queue list MULTIPLE TIMES. I get reported after the end of every game because for some reason I CANNOT connect to the game. So now I'm stuck waiting for my account to get permanently banned OR if that doesn't happen, I'll have to wait 30+Minutes to get into a 5 Minute queue to wait 30 Minutes for a game I can't even connect to to end. So I would like to extend my eternal gratitude to RIOT. Your game is fun WHEN YOU CAN PLAY, but when you're in my situation which I know many other players are in, it sucks more ass than the sodomites stating that the 'Connection Issues are fixed'. So if a RIOTER could either give me an ACTUAL fix to this issue or I don't know, maybe remove the leave-buster BS on my account, that would be GREAT! But it wont happen, this thread will get buried because no one cares and I will have just wasted my time playing this game.

They tested your modem. Sometimes the ISP's internal packet routes are fucked up. I guarantee you will be able to play LoL if you connect via OpenVPN to a VPN based in Los Angeles or Portland/Seattle. OpenVPN is designed to tolerate connection issues and it immediately reconnects to the VPN if the connection is dropped, maintaining the connection to Riot's game servers on the side of the VPN.

If you end up not being able to connect to the VPN then you know what the problem is, your ISP's packet routes, so you would have to change your VPN to a different location like Michigan

There are a lot of issues that could cause a connection problem, everything from your NAT type to open programs on your computer. so here is my best guid on trying them all and see if any works for you. They are listed on order as which is fastest to do. you didnt provide the OS of your computer so im assuming its a Windows PC.

Close all applications running that are not LOL related. This includes background applications and may require you to go into processes to close some others. You should have a maximum of 9 background programs running at any given time.

Flushing DNS is super easy and a very quick test. open command prompt (CMD) and type "ipconfig /flushdns" (without quotes)

Try portfowarding. navigate to 192.168.0.1 in your web browser for router settings (look for a guide for your router) and open all the following ports. (if you require your IPV4 address you can type "ipconfig /a" in CMD, will be 192.168.0.# replacing # with a number.
5000 - 5500 UDP (League of Legends Game Client)
8393 - 8400 TCP (Patcher and Maestro)
2099 TCP (PVP.Net)
5223 TCP (PVP.Net)
5222 TCP (PVP.Net)
80 TCP (HTTP Connections)
443 TCP (HTTPS Connections)
8088 UDP and TCP (Spectator Mode)

While in your router config page disable the firewall. (your PC firewall is more then enough to stop any threats) also disable DDOS protection (unless you publicly give out your IP).

on your PC enable all LOL related .exe files in your firewall (including patcher, client and launcher etc...) for both inbound and outbound connections.

If all those others fail ask your ISP to preform a line test, Although i doubt anything will show up you might as well make sure.
look on your router page for Logs, typically ISPs dont notify you of firmware updates and if one fails your pretty much screwed as they wont let you know or bother to tell you (some knowledge of computer systems may be required to decipher the crap they put on there, google is your best friend.

more support can be found here: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq8

First, relax.  Take a deep breath.  Your account won't be permanently banned for connection issues, even if they're persistent for a while.  It's going to be okay.

It *sounds* to me like this is likely to be a routing issue somewhere between your ISP and Riot's ISP.  Even if your ISP thinks everything is fine within their network, that doesn't mean everything is fine connecting you to Riot's servers in LA.

If you haven't already, try the logging steps listed here: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs under "network analysis" and "tracert".  If you can narrow down where the problem is happening, you might be able to help Riot and/or your ISP figure out what is wrong.
